intro: Prunus domestica var. apyrena, commonly known as the Apyrena plum, is a botanical variant of the common European plum. It is characterized by its small, round fruits that are typically less than 2 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by the development of its unique, sweet-tart fruit. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that thrives in temperate climates. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and its use in culinary applications.
